accountwizard.welcome: Hi, welcome to your own Kresus!
accountwizard.description: This is your personal finance manager, your own daily companion to give you insights on your bank accounts and help you analyze your expenses.
accountwizard.letsgo: Let's set up your first bank access!
accountwizard.import: If you have exported your previous Kresus instance, you can import it back by selecting the JSON file created on export.
accountwizard.default_categories: Add a default set of categories to get you started quickly.
accountwizard.default_categories_desc: This will add a default list of basic and commonly used categories to help you get started.
accountwizard.default_alerts: Add a default set of alerts to help you follow the status of these accounts.
accountwizard.default_alerts_desc: This will add a default set of alerts on these accounts when their balance is low (when your balance gets very low) or high (when you receive incomes). This will also send you a daily report of the status of these accounts.

menu.add_first_access_desc: Add your first access and connect to your bank accounts!
menu.import_desc: Import your data from another instance.
menu.demo_desc: Try Kresus without connecting your real bank accounts, thanks to fake accesses.

accountwizard.no_favorite_code_editor_found: No such code editor found -- try Vim instead.

demo.title: Demo mode
demo.description: The demo mode will create a dummy bank access with several accounts which will contain fake transactions and dummy categories. Once you feel you have tested Kresus enough in demo mode you'll be able to reinitialize it and go back to the previous screen where you'll be able to properly create a real connection to your banks.
demo.disable_warning: This will disable the demo mode and erase all the current data. Are you sure you want to continue?

category.delete_unused: Delete %{smart_count} unused category |||| Delete %{smart_count} unused categories
category.erase: This will erase the "%{label}" category. Do you confirm?
category.no_transactions_attached: There are no transactions attached to this category.
category.attached_transactions: There is %{smart_count} transaction attached. It will not be deleted. |||| There are %{smart_count} transactions attached. They will not be deleted.
category.replace_with_info: You can attach them to an existing category with the dropdown below (by default, these transactions will not have a category set anymore).
category.budget_migration: The attached budgets will also be migrated to the chosen category (unless there already are budgets attached).
category.label: Label

editaccessmodal.customFields_not_empty: Please fill all the custom fields
editaccessmodal.title: Edit bank access
editaccessmodal.body: If your bank password changed, you need to update it in Kresus so that the bank link keeps on syncing operations from your bank account.

disableaccessmodal.title: Disable access
disableaccessmodal.body: You are about to disable this access. By confirming this change, this access will be disabled, the daily fetch will not occur and the password will be deleted.

deleteunusedcategoriesmodal.title: Confirm deletion
deleteunusedcategoriesmodal.explanation: This will delete the following unused categories:
deleteunusedcategoriesmodal.question: Are you sure you want to delete all of them? Associated budgets, if they exist, will also be deleted.

charts.balance_desc: This chart shows you what was the balance at a given moment. This is useful for example to see if you always hit a critical level around the same period.
charts.by_category_desc: This chart shows you month by month how much you spent or earned for each category. It is useful to have a quick glance at how much you spend in a category by month, and how it evolved over time.
charts.differences_all_desc: This chart shows you by month how much you spent, earned and saved over all the accounts of the currently selected bank access. This is useful to see how your savings evolved during the last months: did you save more each month?
charts.help_raw_income: This shows all the transactions which contributed to income for each category. Note that if a category has transactions which are both income and spendings, income will appear here and spendings on the raw spendings chart.
charts.help_raw_spendings: This shows all the transactions which contributed to spendings for each category. Note that if a category has transactions which are both income and spendings, spendings will appear here and income on the raw spendings chart.
charts.help_net_income: This shows all the categories which contributed to income, that is, categories for which the overall sum resulted in gains. If a category has both incoming and outcoming transactions, but income was overall bigger for this category, then it will appear only here.
charts.help_net_spendings: This shows all the categories which contributed to spendings, that is, categories for which the overall sum resulted in losses. If a category has both incoming and outcoming transactions, but spendings were overall bigger for this category, then it will appear only here.

general.network_error: A network error happened. Are you sure your Internet connection is correctly configured and working?
general.json_parse_error: Impossible to parse the response from the server. Either the connection timed out, or there is something wrong with the endpoint. Please contact your local administrator or somebody from the Kresus team.
general.see_developers_console: Please refer to the developers' console for more information.
general.loading_assets: Please wait while Kresus is loading the assetsâ€¦

operations.title: Transactions
operations.warning_delete: Before deleting the operation by this mean, ensure it does not appear in the duplicates list, you can delete it there with the 'merge button'.
operations.are_you_sure: Are you sure you still want to delete the operation %{label} (%{amount}) of %{date} ?
operations.create_category: Click or hit "Enter" to create the category "%{label}".

budget.threshold_help: A negative budget value means a source of expenses, while a positive budget value means a source of income.

settings.optional_field_desc: This field is optional and might be needed under particular circumstances. You should fill it if this makes sense to do so, or if not filling it triggers issues.
settings.custom_label: Choose a custom label for the access.
settings.weboob_fetch_threshold: Number of months before the last fetch until which transactions must be fetched (0 = no limit)
settings.weboob_description: Weboob is the underlying tool used by Kresus to fetch your bank data. This tool's modules (one module per bank) sometimes require to be updated in order to follow the evolutions of the banks' websites.
settings.update_weboob_help: This will update Weboob without reinstalling it from scratch. This should be done as a first step, in case fetching transactions doesn't work anymore.
settings.export_instance_help: This will export all of Kresus data into a format another instance of Kresus can then import back. You can export to a clear-text JSON file (which will not contain bank credentials). If your instance administrator has enabled it, you can also export a backup encrypted with a password (which will contain bank credentials); in this case, the chosen password must contain at least 8 characters, including 1 uppercase letter, 1 lowercase letter and 1 digit.
settings.import_instance_help: This will import an existing instance, exported with the above button. It won't try to merge any data, so please ensure that your data is clean by editing the text file by hand, if needed.
settings.import_disabled_help: Importing previous exports of Kresus is disabled in demo mode.
settings.invalid_encrypted_export: This file isn't a valid encrypted Kresus export file.
settings.invalid_password_json_export: The password used to decrypt is incorrect (or the encrypted file wasn't a valid Kresus export in the first place).
settings.cannot_decrypt_import: Unfortunately, this import is encrypted while this instance doesn't support encryption. Please make sure to only import files from the same instance.
settings.successful_import: Your instance has successfully been imported.
settings.provide_password: Please provide the password for this encrypted import file:
settings.import_invalid_json: The JSON file to import is not valid!
settings.erase_account: This will erase the "%{label}" account, and all its transactions. If this is the last account bound to this bank, the bank will be erased as well. Are you sure about this?
settings.erase_access: This will erase the "%{name}" bank, and all its associated accounts and transactions. Are you sure about this?

resync_account.title: Resync the balance of the account: %{label}
resync_account.make_sure: You are about to resync the balance of your account. Before that, ensure you have:
resync_account.sync_operations: imported all the operations from your bank website
resync_account.are_you_sure: Are you sure you want to proceed?

emails.balance_desc: The balance alerts warn you when the balance of your bank account becomes lower or greater (your choice) than the threshold you defined.
emails.transaction_desc: The transaction alerts warn you when a new transaction is imported and its amount is lower or greater (your choice) than the amount of the threshold you defined.
emails.reports_desc: Reports are sent at the frequency of your choice (daily, weekly or monthly) and aggregate a digest of the current state of your bank accounts: balances and new operations.
emails.send_if_transaction_is: Notify me if a transaction's amount is
emails.delete_alert_full_text: This will erase this alert and you won't receive emails and notifications about it anymore. Are you sure you want to remove this alert?
emails.delete_report_full_text: This will erase this report and you won't receive emails about it anymore. Are you sure you want to remove this alert?
emails.send_test_email_success: The test email was successfully sent
emails.send_test_email_error: Error when trying to send test email: %{error}
emails.emails_not_enabled: Emails haven't been enabled by your administrator. Thus, it is not possible to set any email reports or alerts at this time.

customization.no_themes: No additional themes available. Ask your administrator to install one!
customization.confirm_disable_discovery: Going forward will hide all help messages from the whole application. You'll be able to re-enable those at any time in the Customization settings. Are you sure you want to continue?

logs.confirm_clear: This will reset your logs. Do you wish to continue?

similarity.help: Why do we need this? Sometimes, importing bank transactions may lead to duplicate transactions, e.g. if the bank added information to a given transaction a few days after its effective date. This screen shows similarities between suspected transactions, and allows you to manually remove duplicates. Note: Categories may be transferred upon deletion: if you have a pair of duplicates A/B, in which A has a category but B doesn't, and you choose to delete A, then B will inherit A's category.
similarity.label: Label
similarity.threshold_1: Two transactions will be considered to be duplicates if the time between them is less than the time range threshold, which is set to
similarity.threshold_2: You can change this value in the default parameters by clicking on the cog in the upper right corner, or by clicking the following buttons to find fewer/more duplicates
similarity.default_help: Two transactions will appear in this section if they both happen within this period of time of each other.
similarity.ignore_different_custom_fields: Ignore duplicates which have different custom fields
similarity.ignore_different_custom_fields_desc: If both transactions have a defined type, category or custom label and one of these fields differ between the two transactions, do no count it as a duplicate.
similarity.confirm: Do you confirm merging these two transactions? This action can't be undone!

about.title: About
about.thanks_description: Free software is a whole ecosystem and any software relies on a huge number of dependencies. That is why we are listing here the dependencies used by Kresus and without which this software could not exist.
about.description: Kresus is a personal finance manager that allows you to have a better understanding of what your main expenses are, by computing useful statistics about your bank transactions.

sync.no_accounts: There are no accounts on this bank access, and Kresus needs at least one to work correctly : synchronization is aborted.
sync.no_password: This access' password isn't set. Please set it in your bank settings and retry.
sync.wrong_password: Your password appears to be rejected by the bank website, please go to your Kresus settings and update it.
sync.first_time_wrong_password: The password seems to be incorrect, please type it again.
sync.invalid_parameters: The format of one of your login or password might be incorrect: %{content}
sync.expired_password: Your password has expired. Please change it on your bank website and update it in Kresus.
sync.unknown_module: Your bank requires a module not supported by Kresus (and Weboob) or a dependency is missing. Please try updating Weboob or ask a maintainer.
sync.unknown_error: This is an error unknown to Kresus, please try updating Weboob, and if it doesn't work, please report the error.
sync.action_needed: Your bank's website requires a manual action from you. Please log in manually on your bank's website, follow the instructions, and try again.
sync.auth_method_nyi: The authentication method set for your account is not supported by the module. Please change it on your bank's website to use Kresus.
sync.browser_question: This bank requires to input extra information (for example a One Time Password). Kresus does not implement this feature yet. Try again after disabling the 2 factor authentication.
sync.weboob_not_installed: Weboob is not installed. You will now be redirected to the dedicated help page.

addoperationmodal.label: Title
addoperationmodal.add_operation: Create an operation for the account %{account}
addoperationmodal.description: You're about to create an operation for account %{account}. In case you want to delete an operation which was created by mistake, you can do so by opening its modal in the operations list and clicking delete.
addoperationmodal.warning: Make sure your account is synced before creating it. If you are creating an operation in anticipation of one that you expect to be fetched from your bank, please note that you might have to merge them manually once imported.

weboobinstallreadme.title: Please install Weboob %{minVersion} or later
weboobinstallreadme.content: In order to work as expected, Kresus has a single dependency called Weboob. %{installedText} To offer you the best experience, the latest stable version of Weboob has to be installed (%{minVersion} or later, at this point). Please contact your Kresus administrator so that they'll install Weboob as described in the README file:
weboobinstallreadme.working_version: Kresus has detected that version %{version} of Weboob is installed.
weboobinstallreadme.not_working: Kresus could not detect a working install of Weboob (Weboob or one of its dependencies is not installed correctly).

spinner.title: Please waitâ€¦
spinner.fetch_account: Connecting to your bank's website and fetching all the accounts and transactionsâ€¦
spinner.delete_account: Deleting your account and associated data from Kresusâ€¦
spinner.generic: Kresus is processing your demand, hang tight!
spinner.import: Importing your backup data into Kresusâ€¦
spinner.license: Your Kresus license will expire in 30 days, unless you buy one. Click this link to renew it as soon as possible:

error-reporter.title: Oopsie! Something went wrong ðŸ˜Ÿ.
error-reporter.report: Please report the error below by copying its content and opening a new issue on Kresus'

short.INVALID_PARAMETERS: One parameter of the credentials (login, password...) do not follow the expected format.
short.ACTION_NEEDED: A manual action is required on your bank's website.
short.AUTH_METHOD_NYI: The active authentication method on the bank website is not supported by the module.
short.CONNECTION_ERROR: The server couldn't connect to one data provider (modules repositories or bank web sites).

operation.title: Alert on transaction amount
operation.content: Alert: the transaction "%{label}" from %{date} on the account "%{account}" has an amount of %{amount}, %{cmp} %{limit}.

balance.title: Alert on balance amount
balance.content: Alert: the balance on the account %{label} is %{cmp} alert threshold of %{limit}, with a balance of %{balance}.

email.signature:
Yours truly, Kresus.

(if you would like to unsubscribe or change the frequency to which you receive notifications, log into your Kresus and go to Settings > Alerts)

seeyoulater.notifications: See you soon for new notifications
seeyoulater.report: See you soon for another report

report.subject: Your %{frequency} bank report
report.pre:
Here's your bank report of the %{today}.

Your accounts' balances:
report.new_operations: New operations imported during this period:
report.no_new_operations: No new operations have been imported during that period.

fetch_error.subject: Error when fetching operations
fetch_error.ACTION_NEEDED: A manual action is required on your bank's website
fetch_error.AUTH_METHOD_NYI: The active authentication method on the bank website is not supported by the module.
fetch_error.BROWSER_QUESTION: Accessing this bank requires to input extra information (for example a One Time Password). Kresus does not implement this feature yet. You can disable the two factor authentication and try again.
fetch_error.CONNECTION_ERROR: The server couldn't connect to one data provider (modules repositories or bank web sites).
fetch_error.text:
Kresus detected the following error when fetching operations from the bank %{bank}: 
%{error} (%{message}).
fetch_error.pause_poll: Please note no automatic polling will be retried until you fix the problem

test_email.subject: [Kresus] Test email
test_email.content:
Dear Kresus user,

If you read this email, then your SMTP configuration is correct!

Have a nice day.
Kresus
